definitions.meaning: 与职业或专业相关的；具有高水平技能或资质的
definitions.usage: 描述某人从事某项职业，或某人在工作中表现出高水平的能力、行为或态度。通常用于强调专业性、可靠性或符合行业标准。

examples.scene: 一家科技公司的员工正在参加公司组织的培训课程，以提升自己的职业能力。
examples.chineseIdea: 员工希望通过学习新知识和技能来提升自己在职场中的竞争力。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: She enrolled in a course to enhance her @ @.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: She enrolled in a course to enhance her 「professional development」.
examples.chineseTranslation: 她报名参加了一门课程，以提升她的「职业发展」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'She joined a class to improve her job.' 纠正：'Job' 过于笼统，'professional development' 更具体，指职业技能和知识的提升。

examples.scene: 一位求职者在面试中向面试官展示自己的能力，强调过去的项目经验。
examples.chineseIdea: 求职者想证明自己有足够的能力胜任这份工作。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: He highlighted his @ @ during the interview to impress the employer.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: He highlighted his 「professional skills」 during the interview to impress the employer.
examples.chineseTranslation: 他在面试中强调了自己的「专业技能」，以给雇主留下深刻印象。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'He showed his work ability in the interview.' 纠正：'Work ability' 不地道，'professional skills' 更自然且具体。

definitions.meaning: 职业的；以某职业为生的人
definitions.usage: 指某人以特定职业为生，或者从事某项活动作为全职工作，而不是业余爱好者。通常用于区分职业选手和业余选手。

examples.scene: 一名年轻人在奥运会选拔赛中表现出色，被认为有潜力成为职业选手。
examples.chineseIdea: 他希望通过刻苦训练，从业余选手转变为全职运动员。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: After years of training, she became a @ @ and competed internationally.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: After years of training, she became a 「professional athlete」 and competed internationally.
examples.chineseTranslation: 经过多年训练，她成为了一名「职业运动员」，并参加了国际比赛。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'She is a sports professional.' 纠正：'Sports professional' 不够具体，'professional athlete' 是更自然的表达。

examples.scene: 一位音乐家在音乐会上表演，观众对他的专业水平赞不绝口。
examples.chineseIdea: 音乐家通过多年的练习和演出，达到了职业水准。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: His performance was so impressive that everyone recognized him as a @ @.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: His performance was so impressive that everyone recognized him as a 「professional musician」.
examples.chineseTranslation: 他的表演令人印象深刻，大家都认为他是一名「职业音乐家」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'He is a music professional.' 纠正：'Music professional' 听起来生硬，'professional musician' 更符合英语表达习惯。

definitions.meaning: 得体的；符合职业规范的行为或态度
definitions.usage: 指在工作或正式场合中表现出的礼貌、得体或符合职业道德的行为。通常用于描述态度或举止。

examples.scene: 一名客服代表在处理客户投诉时，始终保持冷静和礼貌。
examples.chineseIdea: 客服希望通过礼貌的沟通解决问题，展现公司的良好形象。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: She handled the complaint with a @ @, which calmed the customer.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: She handled the complaint with a 「professional manner」, which calmed the customer.
examples.chineseTranslation: 她以「职业的态度」处理投诉，平息了客户的不满。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'She used a good manner to deal with the complaint.' 纠正：'Good manner' 过于泛泛，'professional manner' 更贴合职场语境。

examples.scene: 一位新员工在公司会议上穿着得体，表现出积极的态度。
examples.chineseIdea: 新员工希望给同事和上司留下专业的好印象。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: His @ @ during the meeting earned him respect from his colleagues.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: His 「professional attitude」 during the meeting earned him respect from his colleagues.
examples.chineseTranslation: 他在会议中表现出的「职业态度」赢得了同事的尊重。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'He had a good attitude in the meeting.' 纠正：'Good attitude' 缺乏职业化含义，'professional attitude' 更适合正式场合。
